title: Chinese Government provides RMB 239.6 million loan for Di-Ammonium Phosphate Fertilizer Plant Construction Project (Linked to Project ID #39369, #38969)
description: In 2000, the Chinese Government offered $53.29 million of debt financing to the Government of Bangladesh to build an 800 ton-per-day di-ammonia phosphate fertilizer plant in Chittagong. The total cost of the project was $59.21 million, and the Government of Bangladesh agreed to supply the remaining $6 million. Under a contract signed between China National Complete Plant Import and Export Corporation Limited (COMPLANT) and Bangladesh Chemical Industries Corporation (BCIC), the Chinese Government agreed to provide an RMB 200 million loan for the project. The loan agreement was finalized on September 13, 2000, and it carried the following terms: 20-year maturity, 10 year grace period, 0% interest rate. COMPLANT agreed to provide an additional $29.11 million from a supplier’s credit, which in turn funded with the proceeds from an export seller’s credit that it received (see Project ID#38969). A follow-on loan agreement with the Chinese Government for an “800 Metric Tons of 800 MT DI-AMMONIUM PHOSPHATE (DAP) Project” was signed on September 7, 2005 (see Government of Bangladesh loan ID# L1120050907a). This RMB 239,667,000 loan agreement carried the following terms: 16-year maturity, 4 year grace period, and a 2% interest rate. Construction of the di-ammonium phosphate fertilizer plant — known as Di-Ammonium Phosphate Fertiliser Company Ltd (DAPFCL) — was expected to begin at the end of 2000 and projected to commence operations within 30 months. However, the project did not commence until April 2004 and it was not completed until June 2006. In August 2016, an ammonia tank at the plant exploded, causing at least 50 people to fall sick from inhaling toxic gas. The emission of toxic ammonia at the fertilizer factory was brought under control on August 23, 2016, some 11 hours after one of two smaller 500-tonne capacity ammonia storage tanks exploded. Fifty people, including women, were admitted to the Chittagong Medical College Hospital (CMCH). BCIC, which now runs the factory, formed a 10-member committee to investigate the incident. Di-Ammonium Phosphate Fertiliser Company Ltd (DAPFCL) is located within the Anowara Upazilla (SubDistrict) of Chittagong Division. More detailed locational information is available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Di-Ammonium+Phosphate+Fertilizer+Company/@22.219927,91.8293422,15z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0x1b6c5969e926d431!8m2!3d22.219927!4d91.8293422 and http://ksblbd.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Volume-I_Executive-Summary-of-ESIA-Report_KDDL_22-Nov-2019.pdf.STAFF_NOTE: The Government of Bangladesh loan ID# is L1120000913a. The Government of Bangladesh project title is “MTDP DI-AMMONIUM PHOSPHATE (DAP)

title: China donates bullet proof helmets and vests to Bangladesh police
description: In March 2006, China handed over security gear (bullet proof vests and helmets) to the Bangladeshi police as a gesture of friendship. The handover took place between the Chinese Ambassador of Dhaka, Chai Xi, and Bangladesh State Minister for Home Affairs, Lutfozzaman Babar.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=UNIBAG0020060323e23m0000p&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 1.2 billion government concessional loan for Procurement of 6 Oil Vessels Project (Linked to Project ID #55046 and #38342)
description: On November 14, 2016, China Eximbank and the Government of Bangladesh signed an RMB 1,200,000,000 government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the  Procurement of 6 Oil Vessels Project.  The GCL carried the following terms: 2% interest rate, 20-year maturity, a grace period of 5 years. The Government of Bangladesh's loan identification number for the China Eximbank GCL is L1120161014A. The purpose of the project was for Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (BSC) to purchase 3 bulk oil tankers and 3 oil carriers from the China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation. Each ship will have a load of 39,000 tons. The 3 new bulk oil tankers and 3 oil carriers were built by the Yangzijiang Shipbuilding (Holdings) Ltd. for the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (BSC), and they were expected to be delivered in 2018 to join the BSC's existing fleet of 8 ships. The keel laying for the first vessel was concluded on January 30, 2018. The second vessel — a bulk oil tanker — was launched from the slipway of New Yangzi shipyard on June 14, 2018. Two additional vessels were launched on July 25, 2018. Another vessel was launched on February 2, 2018. On January 22, 2019, a 39000DWT tanker was successfully delivered to BSC.  STAFF_NOTE: This project is also known as the 'Purchase of 6 Oil Ships Project'.  Given that the sixth vessel was successfully delivered to BSC on January 22, 2019, we status-code this project as complete and set the date to January 22, 2019.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=JPSTEN0020161003eca3000mf&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.bairdmaritime.com/ship-world/dry-cargo-world/bulker-world/yangzijiang-launches-second-bulker-for-bangladesh-shipping-corporation/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.yzjship.com/en/news_info.asp?id=217, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.yzjship.com/en/news_info.asp?id=177, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.yzjship.com/en/news_info.asp?id=224, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.yzjship.com/en/news_info.asp?id=234, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.yzjship.com/en/news_info.asp?id=275, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.yzjship.com/en/news_info.asp?id=176, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b09c0301_8d15_49e1_8af9_3231f08b8ad8/Tbl-7.2.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://mof.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/mof.portal.gov.bd/page/f2d8fabb_29c1_423a_9d37_cdb500260002/Ch-11%20%20%28English-2019%29.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://mof.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/mof.portal.gov.bd/budget_mof/4d042eb5_638b_4f6c_ade1_ea0a02df82e2/152_Shipping_English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://bsc.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/bsc.portal.gov.bd/news/c4ca72c6_80b0_4081_9fcf_c8245ef10cbb/news.pdf , Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: CMC provides $71 million supplier’s credit for Karnaphuli Paper Mills Modernization Project
description: On May 7, 2001, China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation (CMC) signed supplier's credit agreement with the Government of Bangladesh for the Balancing, Modernisation, Rehabilitation and Expansion (BMRE) of the Karnaphuli Paper Mills in Chittagong. CMC, in turn, secured the funds for the supplier’s credit from an export seller’s credit from China Eximbank.  The total contract value was $84 million, and China Eximbank agreed to cover approximately 85% of the contract value, or $70.965 million. The supplier’s credit carried the following terms: 16-year maturity, 3 year grace period, and a 3.5% interest rate. The Government of Bangladesh’s loan identification number for this supplier’s credit is S1120010507a. The Karnaphuli Paper Mills BMRE Project was intended to expand the production capacity of Karnaphuli Paper Mills from 37500 metric tonnes to 85500 metric tonnes per year, as well as improve the output paper quality of the mill. In 2005, China reportedly agreed to convert the supplier's credit into a concessional loan. However, after the BNP-Jamaat alliance government assumed office, they “shelved” the project without explanation. The idea of the project resumed again in 2014, the loan was reportedly converted into a zero-interest loan worth $87 million. According to the Government of Bangladesh’s Economic Relations Division (ERD), none of the committed funding had been disbursed as of June 30, 2018, so we assume that this project never reached the implementation stage. The Karnaphuli Paper Mills is located in Chandraghona in Chittagong Division. Its exact locational coordinates are available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Karnaphuli+Paper+Mills,+Bangladesh/@22.4757332,92.1399385,17z/data=!4m12!1m6!3m5!1s0x30ad377c631a5bef:0xd7607d5e9ae60257!2sKarnaphuli+Paper+Mills+Limited!8m2!3d22.4757283!4d92.1421272!3m4!1s0x30ad3628830dbb87:0xc92405ded13c4465!8m2!3d22.4760967!4d92.1413416STAFF_NOTE: We record the original terms of the supplier’s credit (as of 2001) in this record and not the amended terms.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=unibag0020010716dx57002ve&pp=1&fcpil=zhcn&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://bdnews24.com/business/2005/05/20/china-agrees-to-convert-suppliers-credit-into-concessionary-loan-for-bmre-of-kpm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.hawker.com.bd/news_details.php?news_id=390319&news_category_id=6&val_lan=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.observerbd.com/2014/12/20/61733.php, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://newsfrombangladesh.net/view.php?hidRecord=55320, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b09c0301_8d15_49e1_8af9_3231f08b8ad8/Tbl-7.3.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sohu.com/49/23/news145412349.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://thefinancialexpress.com.bd/trade/coronavirus-china-backed-projects-facing-disruption-1581740529, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b09c0301_8d15_49e1_8af9_3231f08b8ad8/Tbl-7.3%20%281%29.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.observerbd.com/2014/12/20/61733.php, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides 500 miillion RMB grant for 1,000 fire department motorcycles
description: On October 14, 2016, China committed to grant 500 million RMB (approximately $73.29 million) for the modernization of Bangladesh's Fire Service and Civil Defence. The financial and technical cooperation agreement was signed during President Xi Jinping’s visit to Bangladesh, and is said to be part of the project of Disaster Emergency Operation Centre and Information Platform. The grant will provide for 1000 ‘water mist fire motorcycles’ fitted with modern technologies. The motorcycles will be able to maneuver through Dhaka's crowded streets. The PDF Named "অনুদাৈ ও ঋণচুতির িাতিকা" or "List of Grants and Loans" is a part of Bangladesh's Economic Relations Division's 2017 Annual report.  This PDF confirms the signing date.Chinese Commerce Ministry website reports in August, 2018 that a quality examination of the motorcycles was conducted on August 13-14, 2018, and the shipment is scheduled to be shipped from Tianjin Port on August 29 and is expected to arrive in Bangladesh at the end of September. The reports also identifies the implementing agency as the Jiujiang Fire Fighting Equipment Limited Company(九江消防装备有限公司).
sources: https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b09c0301_8d15_49e1_8af9_3231f08b8ad8/Tbl-6.00.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://en.ntvbd.com/bangladesh/39715/1000-fire-motorcycles-to-be-procured-with-Chinese-assistance, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b09c0301_8d15_49e1_8af9_3231f08b8ad8/Tbl-3.12.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b4e54c5e_8c4b_4df5_b6cc_84ade7365591/6.1%20%281%29.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b4e54c5e_8c4b_4df5_b6cc_84ade7365591/6.12.8_As, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.theindependentbd.com/arcprint/details/68236/2016-11-14, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b4e54c5e_8c4b_4df5_b6cc_84ade7365591/6.12.8_Asia%20%281%29.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/article/shangwubangzhu/201809/20180902786272.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China to conduct hybrid rice technology training program for agricultural technicians in Bangladesh
description: On May 17, 2008, an opening ceremony for a hybrid rice technology training program funded by the Ministry of Science and Technology was held in Bangladesh. The one-month training program will involve technological training for over 30 Bangladesh agricultural technicians.
sources: http://bd.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t454457.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Guangzhou International Economic & Technical Cooperation Company (GIETC) gives $60 million suppliers credit for Greater Dhaka Electricity Distribution Project (part IV)
description: In 2001, the Government of Bangladesh received supplier's credit worth $60 million from Guangzhou International Economic & Technical Cooperation Company (GIETC) for the Expansion and Rehabilitation of 132 KV 33 KV Transmission Line under Phase IV of the Greater Dhaka Electricity Distribution Project. The supplier's credit agreement was reportedly finalized on June 30, 2001. The Government of Bangladesh provided a sovereign guarantee for the supplier's credit on June 17, 2001. The purpose of this project was to construct a nine kilometer 132 KV power supply line, a nine kilometer 132 KV underground cable, a 17 kilometer 33 KV overhead line, a 33 kilometer 33 KV underground cable, and install three 132/33 KV substations with a capacity of 450 MVA. Additionally, through the project, 268 switching stations (11 KV), 82 panels ( 11 KV), a 437.25 kilometer 11 KV underground and aerial cable with necessary accessories, and 1500 pole-mounted sub-stations were to be installed by GIETC. The expected completion date of the project was June 30, 2003. STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese project title is 孟加拉大达卡地区输变电第四期工程国际
sources: https://mof.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/mof.portal.gov.bd/page/e9e8a8c8_8a8b_4536_a18b_fc5ca696650a/St_6a1_en.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/33zi6rk7htcmbl5/%E5%AD%9F%E5%8A%A0%E6%8B%89%E5%A4%A7%E8%BE%BE%E5%8D%A1%E5%9C%B0%E5%8C%BA%E8%BE%93%E5%8F%98%E7%94%B5%E7%AC%AC%E5%9B%9B%E6%9C%9F%E5%B7%A5%E7%A8%8B%E5%9B%BD%E9%99%85%E5%B7%A5%E7%A8%8B%E9%A1%B9%E7%9B%AE%20-%20%E5%AD%9F%E5%8A%A0%E6%8B%89%E5%A4%A7%E8%BE%BE%E5%8D%A1%E5%9C%B0%E5%8C%BA%E8%BE%93%E5%8F%98%E7%94%B5%E7%AC%AC%E5%9B%9B%E6%9C%9F%E5%B7%A5%E7%A8%8B%E5%9B%BD%E9%99%85%E5%B7%A5%E7%A8%8B%E9%A1%B9%E7%9B%AE-Achievements-GIETC.pdf?dl=0, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.mccibd.org/pages/desa-chinese-firm-sign-contract-on-power-project.php, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China Eximbank provides $325 million preferential buyer’s credit for Shahjalal Fertilizer Factory Project (Linked to Project ID #34230)
description: On January 21, 2012, China Eximbank and the Government of Bangladesh signed an RMB 1.6 billion government concessional loan (GCL) and a $325 million preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) for the construction of the Shahjalal fertilizer factory near Fenchugonj Upazila (within the Sylhet District and the Division of Sylhett). Both the GCL and the PBC carried the following terms: 2% interest rate, 20-year maturity, a grace period of 5 years. Project ID#34230 captures the GCL, while this project captures the PBC. The Government of Bangladesh's loan identification number for the China Eximbank GCL is L1120120121a. The Government of Bangladesh's loan identification number for the China Eximbank PBC is B1120120121a. The purpose of this project was to set up a new urea fertilizer factory with a production capacity of 1760 metric tons per day (or 5,80,800 metric tons per year) of granular urea at the premises of Natural Gas Fertilizer Factory Limited (NGFFL) in Fenchugonj Upazila within Sylhet District and the Division of Sylhett. China National Complete Plant Import and Export Corporation Ltd was the EPC contractor for this project.  Its work was overseen by the state-owned Bangladesh Chemical Industries Corporation. China Chengda Engineering Company Ltd. was also involved in project implementation. A foundation stone laying ceremony took place on March 24, 2012. Construction began on or around the same date. The plant was handed over on February 29, 2016. Its originally expected completion date was June 15, 2015. The factory began commercial production on March 1, 2016.  The Shahjalal Fertilizer Factory Project is located 6km south of the Fenchugonj Upazila (within the Sylhet District and the Division of Sylhett) and 4km to the south of Maijgaon Railway Station. More detailed locational information is available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Shahjalal+Fertilizer+Company+Limited/@24.6518429,91.923766,14z/data=!4m8!1m2!2m1!1sNatural+Gas+Fertilizer+Factory+Limited!3m4!1s0x3751a4528bd36571:0x67b59ff2cb522d18!8m2!3d24.6517952!4d91.9412756.STAFF_NOTE: In the document from the Shahjalal Fertilizer Company Limited (SFCL) website, the public assistance is listed as USD 560 million from China or 39,860,800,000 Taka. Therefore, the exchange rate used was 1 USD = 71.18 Taka. Using this exchange rate, the funding listed from the Government of Bangladesh in the document (8,883,672,000 Taka) would equal about USD 124.8 million.

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 9.35 million grant for construction of Chittagong Primary School and Rangpur Primary School
description: In 2009, the Chinese Government and the Government of Bangladesh met at the 12th session of the Joint Commission (JC) and discussed the possibility of China providing assistance for building two primary schools. Bangladesh had initially sought assistance to build 5 schools. In September 2011, China Heilongjiang International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation and the Ministry of Primary and Mass Education of Bangladesh represented their respective governments and signed a contract to construct two rural primary schools with grant funding from the Chinese Government. Construction of the schools was expected to begin in November 2011 and to be completed within 15 months. The total contract amount was 9.35 million yuan. Chongqing Meilian International Warehouse and Transport Group Co Ltd were responsible for delivering essential construction items from China to Bangladesh for the construction of the schools. The items include steel, building materials, and construction equipment that weigh a total of 300 tons. The two rural primary schools are Chittagong Primary School, which has a total area of ​​1,030.40 square meters, and Rangpur Primary School, which covers a total area of ​​1056,69 meters. The construction was divided into two parts: teaching buildings and office buildings. Construction for Chittagong Primary School started on December 13, 2011, and was completed on August 20, 2012. Construction for Rangpur Primary School started on April 16, 2012, and was completed on September 15, 2012.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=DKCOBD0020090828e58s0000l&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/aa/?ref=BBCSAP0020090727e57r001b9&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mltrans.net/sucCase.aspx, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://bd.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201109/20110907752304.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.hljchic.com/qq.htm, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://bd.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201109/20110907752304.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://web.archive.org/web/20160319034923/http://www.hljchic.com/qq.htm, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

location_details: These two rural primary schools are located in the Rangpur Division and the Chittagong Division.

title: China provides agricultural training to Bangladesh (Linked to #33993)
description: In 2009, over 100 Bangladeshis participated in a training program held in China for agriculture and climate change industries. Since 2005, roughly 397 Bangladeshi officials as well as those in technical and economic positions have trained in China, as part of the 2005 MoU on Cooperation in the Field of Agriculture between the Ministry of Agriculture of China and the Ministry of Agriculture of Bangladesh. Project is linked to #33993.

title: China sends first round of relief aid for Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh (Linked to #54501)
description: On 27 September 2017, a Chinese cargo plane carrying 57 tons of aid materials donated by the Chinese government arrived in Chittagong, Bangladesh to assist Rohingya refugees displaced from Myanmar. The value of the donation is unknown. The next day, another Chinese cargo plane with a second aid package (#54501) flew to Bangladesh.
sources: https://www.dhakatribune.com/bangladesh/nation/2017/09/27/first-chinese-relief-rohingya-arrives-chittagong, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-10/13/c_136676659.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Wuhan Textile University and Bangladesh's Southeast University create Joint Textile Engineering Undergraduate Program
description: In 2015, a Memorandum of Understanding was signed to develop a joint undergraduate program on textile engineering. This program would be between Southeast University in Bangladesh and Wuhan Textile University in China. Under the agreement, the two universities will exchange students and faculty members from various disciplines. This project is similar to #52668, where a similar joint programs was developed between the WTU and Bangladeshi universities.

title: China grants 70 Government Scholarships to Bangladeshi students for AY2010/2011
description: China provided Bangladesh with 70 scholarships of various kinds for the academic year 2010/2011.

title: China funds 'China Research Center' in the University of Dhaka
description: On February 8, 2015, an opening ceremony was held for the China Research Center, funded by the Chinese Embassy in Bangladesh, at the University of Dhaka. The Chinese Embassy also donated some books to the research center during the ceremony. The financial value of the research center is unknown. This project assumes that the Chinese embassy committed to funding the project in 2014, but no sources addressed the commitment date.
sources: http://bd.chineseembassy.org/chn/zmjw/t1235520.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China Grants Debt Relief to Bangladesh for Interest Free Loan Due in 2008
description: During a state visit to China from March 17-21, 2010, the Bangladeshi Prime Minister, Sheikh Hasina, the Chinese President, Hu Jintao, and the Chinese Premier, Wen Jiabao, signed the Protocol on Remitting the Bangladesh Interest-free Loan due in 2008. This agreement was signed along with an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement, Framework Agreement on Providing Preferential Loans, and Exchange of Letters on the Construction of the Seventh Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge. The exact amount of the loan is unknown.

title: China grants 67 Government Scholarships to Bangladeshi students for AY2014/2015 (Link to #38326, #38327)
description: In 2014, 67 Bangladeshis were awarded the Chinese Government Scholarship to study in China for the academic year 2014/15.

title: Syndicated loan for the Unit 3 of the 220MW Sirajganj Combined Cycle Power Plant Project (Linked to Project ID#56541)
description: In 2017, a $196.7 million syndicated loan (involving Bank of China debt) was signed to North-West Power Generation Company Limited for Unit 3 of the 220MW Sirajganj Combined Cycle Power Plant Project (also known as the Sirajganj 3 Project). Northwest Power Generation Company Limited is a state-owned power and electric company in Bangladesh. It is a 100% subsidiary of Bangladesh Power Development Board. The transaction was structured as a long term loan with 15-year maturity split into 3 tranches: a $118.36 million Sinosure-insured loan tranche from Bank of China and Siemens Bank; a $34.03 million Euler Hermes-insured tranche from Deutsche Pfandbriefbank AG, and a $44.34 million commercial tranche with MIGA NHSFO insurance from Standard Charted Bank debt. The Government of Bangladesh (“GOB”) provided a sovereign guarantee for debt service. The loan will cover 80% of the costs, with the other 20% coming from Northwest Power Generation Company Limited. China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation (“CMC”) and Fujian Electric Power Survey and Design Institute (“FEDI”) are the EPC contractors responsible for project implementation. Under the EPC contract, the contractors were required to commission the project within 2.5 years of the start date. Construction of the third unit of electricity generators (Sirajganj 3) began on October 19, 2017, and the plant began commercial operations on January 20, 2019. CMC and FEDI were also the contractors responsible for the implementation of the Bank of China and China Eximbank-financed Unit 2 of the 220MW Sirajganj Combined Cycle Power Plant Project. This project is linked to project #56541, the construction of the Surajganj 2 Power Plant, financed by China Eximbank and Bank of China.
sources: http://www.icbc.com.cn/ICBC/外部调用/一带一路最佳项目评选/04.htm, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://w2.siemens.com.cn/stories/StoryShow/GetStoryDetail/195?culture=en-US&sourceId=1, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/jlok98vklas7iz3/North-West%20Power%20Generation%20Company%20Limited%E2%80%93%20Sirajganj%20Unit%203%20--%20Bangladesh.pdf?dl=0, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.dropbox.com/s/l8z6yatstsd64jz/21_05.pdf?dl=0, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.nwpgcl.org.bd/current-plant/sirajganj-225-mw-combined-cycle-power-plant-unit-3-, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.ippjournal.com/news/north-west-power-generation-company-signs-debt-on-230-mw-sirajganj-ipp, Other; https://www.gtreview.com/news/asia/another-big-loan-signed-in-bangladeshs-power-sector/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.theasset.com/belt-road-online/32535/standard-chartered-supports-chinese-built-power-project-in-bangladesh, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.hlfdw.com/xiangmujianshe/20171026187779.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides technical assistance to construction of technical institute in Bangladesh
description: In 2017, China announced plans to assist with the construction of a technical institute in Bangladesh. China sent advisers to provide technical support in order to establish the institute, but it is unclear which Chinese entity sent them. The technical institute, with special focus on power engineering courses, will be set up under the supervision of Bangladesh China Institute of Technology (BCIT) and Lanzhou Jiaotong University of China. Under the course, students will study first two years in Dhaka at Stamford University and last two years at Lanzhou Jiaotong University in China for getting first hand practical training with modern lab facilities. The power engineering course following Chinese curriculum started in 2018 January.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ENEPOW0020171121edbu00008&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.jagonews24.com/en/education/news/33934, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.daily-sun.com/printversion/details/267258/Chinese-university-to-launch-Power-Engineering-course-in-Bangladesh, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates office supplies to Bangladesh Congress
description: On November 27, 2008, China donated a batch of office supplies to Bangladesh Congress.
sources: http://bd.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t524334.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 500 million grant for 9th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge Construction Project over the Bogha River
description: On May 11, 2017, China’s Ambassador to Bangladesh, Ma Mingqiang, and Mr. Kazi Shofiqul Azam, Secretary of Economic Relations Division (ERD) within the Ministry of Finance of Bangladesh signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ECTA). Through this agreement, the Chinese Government committed RMB 500 million for the construction of the 9th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge, which is also known as the Bogha (sometimes spelled Boga) Bridge. The proposed 400-meter long Boga Bridge will pass over River Lohalia on Lebukhali-Bhauphal-Dasmina-Golachipa-Amragachia road in Patuakhali district. Upon completion will connect Patuakhali Sadar, Dumki upazila with Bhauphal, Dashmina, and Golachipa upazila as well as the sea beach and Sonarchar sanctuary of Barguna district alongside the Kuakata sea beach and the 3rd Payra seaport. In October 2015, China’s Ministry of Commerce commissioned the China Communications Highway Planning and Design Institute to conduct a comprehensive investigation of the construction of the 9th bridge. However, there is no evidence that this project has reached the construction stage.
sources: https://mygoldenbengal.wordpress.com/2014/11/09/china-bangladesh-friendship-elevated-to-strategic-partnership/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b09c0301_8d15_49e1_8af9_3231f08b8ad8/Tbl-6.00.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://bd.china-embassy.org/eng/dshd/t1461414.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2017-05/11/c_136274644.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/press_release/42a4c392_b751_46ec_b54f_09c056bcc2a3/PR%20china%2011517E.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.theindependentbd.com/post/94198, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/world/2017-05/11/content_29308273.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://world.huanqiu.com/hot/2016-10/9590157.html?agt=15422, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.bssnews.net/?p=33076, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/notices/5609756a_29ab_4299_ab2b_3c90c2d5464c/PR%20china%2011517E.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2017-05/11/c_136274644.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.observerbd.com/details.php?id=97065, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.observerbd.com/2015/03/29/80561.php, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China establishes the Shanto Mariam Confucius Classroom at the University of Creative Technology
description: On February 15, 2009, under the guidance of China Hanban, a Confucius Classroom was launched in Dhaka, Bangladesh with the joint effort of China Radio International (CRI) and Bangladesh's Shanto Mariam Foundation. The Shanto Mariam Confucius Classroom was launched at the University of Creative Technology. The purpose is to further education and cultural exchange between Bangladesh and China. STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese name for this project is 山度•玛利亚姆孔子课堂.
sources: http://bd.china-embassy.org/eng/dshd/t1363408.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.daily-sun.com/arcprint/details/420157/Learning-Chinese-creates-opportunities-for-Bangladeshi-youths-/2019-09-02, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-03/17/c_136137275.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.china.org.cn/international/2009-02/15/content_17279561.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/gjhdq_676201/gj_676203/yz_676205/1206_676764/sbgx_676768/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://goabroad.sohu.com/20100217/n270275053.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
location_details: The University of Creative Technology in Chittagong

title: China grants Tk 354 million for medical equipment and appliances
description: In 2015, AMA Muhith, Bangladesh's Finance Minister, and Gao Hucheng, China’s commerce minister, signed two Letters of Exchange (LEs). In one letter China pledged to collect medical equipments and appliances for the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The funding came from a Chinese grant of Tk 35.4 crore (TK 354 million).The coder did follow-up research in both English and Chinese, but could not find any  information relating to the progress of the project. Unsure if transaction ever occured.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=UNIBAG0020150825eb8p0000k&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dhakatribune.com/uncategorized/2015/08/25/china-interested-to-invest-300m-in-bangladesh-textile-sector, Media Report, including Wikileaks
